description: IR Remote Button Mapping Configuration for Luma Mirror
note: Supports multiple remote types - both full-featured TV remotes and simple media remotes

KEY_PREVIOUS.description: Go back / Exit submenu (previous track button |◀◀)

KEY_9.description: Go back / Exit submenu (number 9 for simple remotes)

KEY_NEXT.description: Next widget in rearrange mode (next track button ▶▶|)

KEY_2.description: Next widget in rearrange mode (number 2 for simple remotes)

KEY_8.description: Previous widget in rearrange mode (number 8 for simple remotes)

KEY_0.description: Decrease brightness (numeric key for simple remotes)

KEY_1.description: Increase brightness (numeric key for simple remotes)

fullFeaturedTVRemote.description: TV remote with dedicated CH, BACK, and VOL buttons

simpleMediaRemote.description: Simple IR remote without CH or BACK buttons (like ELEGOO remote)

notes: Button names (e.g., KEY_POWER) come from LIRC and are defined in your remote's configuration file
This configuration supports BOTH full-featured TV remotes AND simple media remotes
For simple remotes without BACK: Use Previous track button (|◀◀) or number 9
For simple remotes without CHANNEL buttons: Use Next/Prev track buttons (▶▶|/|◀◀) or numbers 2/8
To customize mappings for your specific remote, edit server/ir-remote-server.js and restart the IR server
The 'action' field must match one of the button actions in the Luma app (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, OK, BACK, POWER, CHANNEL_UP, CHANNEL_DOWN, BRIGHTNESS_UP, BRIGHTNESS_DOWN)
